question: 3. We must remember that what we teach our children is what we (inculcate) in them. (14 July, 2023)
4. She had an ability to (persuade) others. (14 July, 2023)

7. Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word from the sentence. (Ready) She was preparing dinner in an organised manner using well-equipped tools while listening to the radio. (14 July, 2023)
12. The salesman (yielded) to the demands of his corrupt boss. (14 July, 2023)
13. He was offered a __________ (moderate) price for his bungalow. (14 July, 2023)
14. Natwar was a fraudster who always tried to (fooling) others. (17 July, 2023)
16. The efforts will be ______ (vain) if we do not submit the project report on time. (17 July, 2023)

17. The case of Vanuatu in 2020 is a clear example of the constant and complex challenges faced by SIDS. It shows how SIDS are dealing with multiple crises at the same time and how COVID-19 has particularly exposed SIDS’ extreme and (interlinked) vulnerabilities (17 July, 2023)

18. Select the most appropriate synonym of the (‘Vigilant’) from the following options. The burglar was very cautious, so he avoided the security perfectly as they didn’t find any proof. (17 July, 2023)
20. The company was engaged in (spurious) trade practices. (18 July, 2023)
21. I always enjoy the company of (respectful) teachers. (18 July, 2023)
22. He became _____ (verbose) after a few drinks. (18 July, 2023)
23. Last week’s rain (ravaged) the whole city. (18 July, 2023)
26. The government’s (utilitarian) stance was appreciated by all. (18 July. 2023)
27. The committee wanted us to (explain) this in detail. (18 July, 2023)

28. The outcome document of the Rio+20 Conference, the Future We Want, underscores climate change as “an (inevitable) and urgent global challenge with long-term implications for the sustainable development of all countries”. Through the document, Member States express their concern about the continuous rising of emissions of greenhouse gases and the vulnerability of all countries, particularly developing countries, to the adverse impacts of climate change. (18 July, 2023)
29. In the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, Member States express their commitment to protect the planet from (degradation) and take urgent action on climate change. (18 July, 2023)
33. The (benevolent) gesture of the rich merchant was appreciated by all. (19 July, 2023)
34. He is very _______ (Eager) to join the Air Force. (19 July, 2023)
39. One should (follow) the role models in life. (19 July, 2023)
40. It was due to (treacherous) leaders that he decided to leave the party. (19 July, 2023)
41. The investment scheme had been a (scam) all along. (20 July, 2023)
42. The hunter drew his bow, but only managed (to sever) the paw of the wolf before the wolf ran off. (20 July, 2023)
46. She had the (temerity) to call her teacher a liar. (20 July, 2023)

47. From the outset of the pandemic, the United Nations system mobilised early and comprehensively. It led on the global health response, provided lifesaving humanitarian assistance to the most (vulnerable), established instruments for rapid responses to the socioeconomic impact and laid out a broad policy agenda for action on all fronts. (20 July, 2023)
49. After my first visit to Boston, I spent almost every winter in the North. Once I went on a visit to a New England village with its frozen lakes and (vast) snow fields. (21 July, 2023)

50. During the summer of 1893, Miss Sullivan and I visited the World’s Fair with Dr. Alexander Graham Bell. I recall with unmixed (delight) those days when a thousand childish fancies became beautiful realities. (21 July, 2023)
54. Arthur has some strange ideas, but on this occasion, I am (inclined) to agree with him. (21 July, 2023)

57. For many, a warming climatic system is expected to impact the availability of basic necessities like freshwater, food security, and energy, while efforts to redress climate change, both through adaptation and (mitigation), will similarly inform and shape the global development agenda. (24 July, 2023)

59. In order to support countries with a concerted approach for an inclusive, and government-led assessment of post-disaster damages, losses, and recovery needs, as well as the development of a (comprehensive) recovery plan, the European Commission, the World Bank, and the United Nations adopted the Post Disaster Needs Assessment (PDNA) process in 2008. (24 July, 2023)

61. Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word from the sentence. (Dangerous) The traffic police have released a safe advisory that driving without seat belts is risky, beneficial, and fearful for human life. (24 July, 2023)
64. We have always been told (retaliation) is not the key to resolving problems. (24 July, 2023)
65. The hot sun (enervated) the labourer to the extent that he collapsed. (24 July, 2023)

71. The Department of Educational Policy is (committed) to the study of educational policy, analyse, and evaluate educational programmes, to identify trends, understand outcomes and guide policy and practice, towards finding solutions to current problems in educational governance and management.  (25 July, 2023)
73. The boxer showed (audacity) by agreeing to fight the champion. (25 July, 2023)
75. A strong man is a mediator between divine and (mortal) fate. (26 July, 2023)
76. His (modest) nature made all the difference. (26 July, 2023)

77. The internationally agreed Declaration of the Small Island Developing States [SIDS] Accelerated Modalities of Action, the socalled S.A.M.O.A Pathway, recognises that SIDS remains a special case for (sustainable) development in view of their unique and particular vulnerabilities. (26 July, 2023)
78. In most organisations there are (predators) who take advantage over the meek ones. (26 July, 2023)
80. This is (credible) information provided by the informer. (27 July, 2023)

81. A wide–ranging effort is being made to safeguard lives and livelihoods by addressing the (devastating) near-term socio-economic, humanitarian, and human rights aspects of the crisis with attention to those hit the hardest.  (27 July, 2023)

83. Select the synonym of the word (‘reproduce’) from the sentence. Many scientific researches have proved that DNA replicates itself in the human body and is an enzyme based catalyst reaction. (27 July, 2023)
84. The weather forecast mentioned that there would be a (cloud burst) this afternoon. (27 July, 2023)

85. I have thus far sketched the events of my life, but I have not shown how much I have depended on books not only for pleasure and for the (wisdom) they bring to all who read, but also for that knowledge which comes to others through their eyes and their ears. (27 July, 2023)
89. The (sporadic) instructions of the invigilators distracted the examinee. (1 December, 2022)

96. If we want to progress, we must sometimes embrace __________ (mutate). (2 December, 2022)
97. Visiting a book fair always fills my heart with a great (satisfaction). (2 December, 2022)

101. Select the most appropriate synonym of the word (‘stagnant’) from the following sentence. Reeta was motionless after knowing that her brother had become mentally unstable after seeing the fatal accident on Tuesday night. (3 December, 2022)

136. The heavy and (abundant) rainfall has a major role to play in the production of crops. (8 December, 2022)
